alert.note: Alert for Western Twin Falls BLM (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 27 at 2:31PM MDT until July 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY... .Dry southwest flow aloft will continue through Saturday. As a result, gusty southwest winds with low relative humidity will continue into early this evening across Southwest Idaho, especially near the Nevada border, and redevelop Friday afternoon and evening. Gusty winds will spread to Southeast Oregon and far Southwest Idaho on Saturday. The dry and gusty combination will result in periods of critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR WESTERN TWIN FALLS BLM...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 424... * WINDS...15 to 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.
